channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Babe Ruth jersey of ‘called shot’ fame sells for record $24 million
item.description: The road jersey is said to have been worn by the legendary slugger when he predicted his home run in the 1932 World Series. What actually happened has been the subject of debate for 92 years.
item.content:encoded:
The road jersey is said to have been worn by the legendary slugger when he predicted his home run in the 1932 World Series. What actually happened has been the subject of debate for 92 years.

(Image credit: LM Otero)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Israel and Hezbollah engage in intense cross-border fighting
item.description: On Sunday, Israel and Hezbollah exchanged some of the heaviest cross border fighting in months.
item.content:encoded: On Sunday, Israel and Hezbollah exchanged some of the heaviest cross border fighting in months.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: In Palau, residents are divided on easing fishing restrictions
item.description: Palau made history a decade ago when it closed off 80% of its oceans to any kind of fishing. A proposal to open up some of its marine sanctuary to fishing has divided residents on how best to protect the oceans around the Pacific nation.
item.content:encoded: Palau made history a decade ago when it closed off 80% of its oceans to any kind of fishing. A proposal to open up some of its marine sanctuary to fishing has divided residents on how best to protect the oceans around the Pacific nation.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: The Paralympics begin in Paris this week. Here's what to watch for
item.description: The 2024 Paralympics get underway this week in Paris. More than 4,400 athletes with various disabilities will participate in 22 sports.
item.content:encoded: The 2024 Paralympics get underway this week in Paris. More than 4,400 athletes with various disabilities will participate in 22 sports.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Doctors lead protests in India after a young doctor is abused and murdered
item.dc:creator: Adrian Ma

item.title: Ethiopia and Nigeria are floating their currencies. Could instability follow?
item.description: NPR's Adrian Ma speaks with Cerian Richmond Jones of The Economist about the decision by Nigerian and Ethiopian governments to float their respective currencies.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Adrian Ma speaks with Cerian Richmond Jones of The Economist about the decision by Nigerian and Ethiopian governments to float their respective currencies.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Ma

item.title: Should tips be taxed? Economists weigh in
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong

item.title: How would banning taxes on tips actually work?
item.description:
Both major party presidential nominees Donald Trump and Kamala Harris are on the same side of one issue. Getting rid of taxes on tips. But what would that really look like in practice?

Wailin Wong and Darian Woods from NPR's daily economics podcast, The Indicator, dive into the potential guardrails for a policy that many economists believe could easily go off track.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
Both major party presidential nominees Donald Trump and Kamala Harris are on the same side of one issue. Getting rid of taxes on tips. But what would that really look like in practice?

Wailin Wong and Darian Woods from NPR's daily economics podcast, The Indicator, dive into the potential guardrails for a policy that many economists believe could easily go off track.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

(Image credit: Ethan Miller)

item.title: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov arrested in France, reports say
item.description: The Russian-born tech billionaire is a citizen of France and the UAE. Telegram, which he co-founded in 2013, has nearly 1 billion users. It’s known for its hands-off approach to content moderation.
item.content:encoded:
The Russian-born tech billionaire is a citizen of France and the UAE. Telegram, which he co-founded in 2013, has nearly 1 billion users. It’s known for its hands-off approach to content moderation.

(Image credit: Steve Jennings)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Border Patrol agent arrested for allegedly forcing women to undress during processing
item.description: Charging documents say the border patrol agent in upstate New York lied to four women that exposing themselves was part of protocol.
item.content:encoded:
Charging documents say the border patrol agent in upstate New York lied to four women that exposing themselves was part of protocol.

(Image credit: Suzanna Cordeiro)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
